intro: Corchorus pinnatipartitus, commonly known as the Chinese brookweed, is a flowering plant native to Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its delicate, palmately lobed leaves and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in wet or marshy habitats, preferring moist soil conditions. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both horticulture and ecological studies.
